Class BHCompoundBlob

java.lang.Object
  BHBlob
      BHCompoundBlob

public class BHCompoundBlob
extends BHBlob

This class is a container for related BHSingleBlobs. As things have evolved it became apparent that this is the primary class for user interface. It allows users to gather groups related single blobs, like the parts of a planktonic chain.

The ID label of the CompoundBlob is the ID label of the _first_ single blob contained.

Outer and Inner contours (CCL or crack when implemented) are those of the constituent SingleBlobs.

The convex hull of the Compound Blob is the convex hull of the constituent outer boundaries.

Contact: Mike Sieracki, msieracki@bigelow.org
Author: Ben Tupper, btupper@bigelow.org
History: Developed over the course of 2009 and 2010 using ImageJ 1.43 and Mac OSX 10.5.8
at Bigelow Laboratory for Ocean Science, www.bigelow.org

2010-02-27 BTT convert to using Calibration for coordinate conversion 2010-04-07 BTT added "crack" boundary stuff

computeStats

public void computeStats()
This method computes the stats for this CompundBlob. 1. reset the values 2. if 0 SingleBlob then return with values reset 3. if one or more then compute the aggregate values grayscale stats are computes just like in ImageJ (see ByteStatistics.calculateMoments for example)

public ImageProcessor createProcessor()
Creates a FLoatProcessor of the correct width and height and populated with pixel values - background is 0. The edge padding defaults to 4.

createProcessor in class BHBlob
Parameters:
